New Records: Weston Wilson drove in the tiebreaking run with an infield single, marking the third-straight game a Philadelphia bench player came up with the go-ahead hit.
Nick Castellanos homered, reaching his sixth career season with 20 home runs.
Key Match Events: Weston Wilson's tiebreaking run in the sixth inning was a turning point.
Nick Castellanos hit a solo home run in the first inning to give the Phillies an early lead.
The benches almost cleared after Castellanos was hit by a pitch again in the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies reduced their magic number to clinch their first National League East title since 2011 to nine.
Tampa Bay manager Kevin Cash apologized to Nick Castellanos for the previous day's incident where Castellanos was intentionally hit by a pitch.
Post-Match Reflections: Weston Wilson expressed his surprise at the Rays' claim that the ball hit him, but he was focused on the win.
Nick Castellanos showed respect for Tampa Bay manager Kevin Cash for his honesty and apology.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zack Wheeler allowed two runs over six innings to earn the win.
Carlos Estevez pitched a scoreless ninth for his 25th save.
The Rays scored their two runs on an RBI single and a solo home run.
